values.title: Rope physics

content.raw:
I started tinkering with the bullet soft body rope functions. They aren't documented, but I figured out what the parameters do and wrote some of my own comments on my fork of bullet in the following commit:

https://github.com/scpeters/bullet3/commit/dec73fc6da43e36c5dd9de687caf923d88a4497f

@iche033 

[Code for CreateRope function](https://github.com/bulletphysics/bullet3/blob/master/src/BulletSoftBody/btSoftBodyHelpers.cpp#L670-L699)

[Some more hacking on a rope demo](https://github.com/scpeters/bullet3/commit/1690458d10195fd2577e094ecb426c35f1fe249e)
content.html:
I started tinkering with the bullet soft body rope functions. They aren't documented, but I figured out what the parameters do and wrote some of my own comments on my fork of bullet in the following commit:

https://github.com/scpeters/bullet3/commit/dec73fc6da43e36c5dd9de687caf923d88a4497f

@iche033

Code for CreateRope function

Some more hacking on a rope demo

values.title: Integrate M2 component inspector

content.raw:
override double click event to show the component inspector when an component is selected 

same for right click context menus - need to add an `Open Component Inspector` menu option
(and hide the Open Link Inspector menu option)
content.html:
override double click event to show the component inspector when an component is selected

same for right click context menus - need to add an Open Component Inspector menu option (and hide the Open Link Inspector menu option)

values.title: Support nested model

content.raw:
e.g.

~~~

<model>

    <model name=”AA_battery”>
        ...
    </model>

    <model name=”power_switch”>
        ...
    </model>

    <model name=”motor”>
        ...
    </model>

</model>
~~~
content.html:
e.g.

<model>

    <model name=”AA_battery”>
        ...
    </model>

    <model name=”power_switch”>
        ...
    </model>

    <model name=”motor”>
        ...
    </model>

</model>

values.title: Create model plugin to handle <connections>

content.raw:
parse `<connection>` and create  topics where the M2 components can exchange data

e.g.

~~~
      <connection>
        <source>AA_battery</source>
        <source_port>positive</source_port>
        <target>power_switch</target>
        <target_port>connector0</target_port>
      </connection>
      <connection>
        <source>power_switch</source>
        <source_port>connector1</source_port>
        <target>motor</target>
        <target_port>connector0</target_port>        
      <connection>
~~~
content.html:
parse <connection> and create topics where the M2 components can exchange data

e.g.

      <connection>
        <source>AA_battery</source>
        <source_port>positive</source_port>
        <target>power_switch</target>
        <target_port>connector0</target_port>
      </connection>
      <connection>
        <source>power_switch</source>
        <source_port>connector1</source_port>
        <target>motor</target>
        <target_port>connector0</target_port>        
      <connection>

values.title: Components lose their joints when inserted on other models

content.raw:
1. Right click a model (nested or not) and edit it 

1. Insert a switch

1. Save and exit

1. Press play on simulation - the switch has no joints and part of it falls down.

This doesn't happen when building a model from scratch, only when editing.
content.html:
1. Right click a model (nested or not) and edit it

  2. Insert a switch

  3. Save and exit

  4. Press play on simulation - the switch has no joints and part of it falls down.

This doesn't happen when building a model from scratch, only when editing.

content.raw: the schematic view of the motor+gearbox model is a little confusing.  it would be really excellent if the components of the motor+gearbox were included INSIDE the block called motor+gearbox assembly, instead of just disconnected blocks.  Would be even better if the motor shaft output was connected with a fixed joint to the gearbox input, and gearbox output was a fixed joint to the wheel_axle.
content.html: the schematic view of the motor+gearbox model is a little confusing. it would be really excellent if the components of the motor+gearbox were included INSIDE the block called motor+gearbox assembly, instead of just disconnected blocks. Would be even better if the motor shaft output was connected with a fixed joint to the gearbox input, and gearbox output was a fixed joint to the wheel_axle.

values.title: Use unscoped names in connection events

content.raw:
Right now they show like this on the learning companion

~~~
ModelPreview_0::AA_battery has been connected to ModelPreview_0::power_switch
~~~

`ModelPreview` is supposed to be something internal to the Model Editor
content.html:
Right now they show like this on the learning companion

ModelPreview_0::AA_battery has been connected to ModelPreview_0::power_switch

ModelPreview is supposed to be something internal to the Model Editor

values.title: Connection event doesn't show the port

content.raw:
The ports should be mentioned in the event message.

right now, the information we get is:

```
#!c++

ModelPreview_0::motor has been connected to ModelPreview_0::AA_battery
```
content.html:
The ports should be mentioned in the event message.

right now, the information we get is:

ModelPreview_0::motor has been connected to ModelPreview_0::AA_battery

Instead of showing an error message, Gazebo freezes

values.title: update revolute joints with zero limits to fixed joints
Gearbox is highlighted while making wires

content.raw: The gearbox highlights on hover while making a wire but clicking on it doesn't let create a wire (but does select it). It probably shouldn't be highlighted.
content.html: The gearbox highlights on hover while making a wire but clicking on it doesn't let create a wire (but does select it). It probably shouldn't be highlighted.

values.title: Pose of copied shape not honored in paste operation

content.raw:
Copy and paste of simple shapes in model editor doesn't honor pose (and likely other properties) of copied shape.

Steps to recreate:

1) Enter model editor

2) Add cylinder

3) Rotate cylinder 90 degrees (eg, to create a wheel on a car)

4) Copy the rotated cylinder with Ctrl-C

5) Paste copied shape with Ctrl-V
content.html:
Copy and paste of simple shapes in model editor doesn't honor pose (and likely other properties) of copied shape.

Steps to recreate:

1) Enter model editor

2) Add cylinder

3) Rotate cylinder 90 degrees (eg, to create a wheel on a car)

4) Copy the rotated cylinder with Ctrl-C

5) Paste copied shape with Ctrl-V

values.title: Add Edit menu item to Model Editor toolbar

content.raw: Common editing operations like copy and paste aren't obvious in the Model Editor.   Adding an Edit item to the toolbar with Copy and Paste items would make the editor behave like other editing tools.
content.html: Common editing operations like copy and paste aren't obvious in the Model Editor. Adding an Edit item to the toolbar with Copy and Paste items would make the editor behave like other editing tools.

values.title: Move Wire button from left palette to Toolbar icon
Allow Negative Inertia Tensor Elements in Model Editor Link Inspector GUI

content.raw:
It seems to be not allowed to enter a negative value for the inertia tensor elements in the link inspector.  This is fine for the moments of inertia (the Ixx, Iyy, Izz ones), but the other ones (e.g. Ixy) can be negative sometimes.
reference: http://ocw.mit.edu/courses/aeronautics-and-astronautics/16-07-dynamics-fall-2009/lecture-notes/MIT16_07F09_Lec26.pdf
content.html: It seems to be not allowed to enter a negative value for the inertia tensor elements in the link inspector. This is fine for the moments of inertia (the Ixx, Iyy, Izz ones), but the other ones (e.g. Ixy) can be negative sometimes. reference: http://ocw.mit.edu/courses/aeronautics-and-astronautics/16-07-dynamics-fall-2009/lecture-notes/MIT16_07F09_Lec26.pdf

values.title: use entered link name in stl import in Model Editor

content.raw: When I add an stl file in the Model Editor and give it a different name in the import dialog, it still shows up with a default name of "link_0" or "link_1" on the left in the list of links and in the sdf file.
content.html: When I add an stl file in the Model Editor and give it a different name in the import dialog, it still shows up with a default name of "link_0" or "link_1" on the left in the list of links and in the sdf file.

values.title: Crash: moving model 01

content.raw: Crash report:   created plot of Y vs T and another plot of Z vs T.   Relabeled titles of each plot accordingly, hitting enter after each plot title was entered.  went to reposition model view angle so as to view model in remaining fraction of screen.   Could not move model.  A second or two later,  screen grayed out and program crashed.
content.html: Crash report: created plot of Y vs T and another plot of Z vs T. Relabeled titles of each plot accordingly, hitting enter after each plot title was entered. went to reposition model view angle so as to view model in remaining fraction of screen. Could not move model. A second or two later, screen grayed out and program crashed.

values.title: Reverse parent-child relationship for wires in Model Editor

content.raw: Currently, users must delete a wire to rewire it in a different direction. It would be great if users could open a Wire Inspector and swap the direction of the wire.
content.html: Currently, users must delete a wire to rewire it in a different direction. It would be great if users could open a Wire Inspector and swap the direction of the wire.
